trans-unit.source: Connect Excel to Hadoop with the Hive ODBC Driver | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Connect Excel to Hadoop with the Hive ODBC Driver | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to set up and use the Microsoft Hive ODBC driver for Excel to query data in an HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to set up and use the Microsoft Hive ODBC driver for Excel to query data in an HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: Connect Excel to Hadoop with the Microsoft Hive ODBC driver
trans-unit.target: Connect Excel to Hadoop with the Microsoft Hive ODBC driver

trans-unit.source: Microsoft's Big Data solution integrates Microsoft Business Intelligence (BI) components with Apache Hadoop clusters that have been deployed by the Azure HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft's Big Data solution integrates Microsoft Business Intelligence (BI) components with Apache Hadoop clusters that have been deployed by the Azure HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: An example of this integration is the ability to connect Excel to the Hive data warehouse of an Hadoop cluster in HDInsight using the Microsoft Hive Open Database Connectivity (ODBC) Driver.
trans-unit.target: An example of this integration is the ability to connect Excel to the Hive data warehouse of an Hadoop cluster in HDInsight using the Microsoft Hive Open Database Connectivity (ODBC) Driver.

trans-unit.source: It is also possible to connect the data associated with an HDInsight cluster and other data sources, including other (non-HDInsight) Hadoop clusters, from Excel using the Microsoft Power Query add-in for Excel.
trans-unit.target: It is also possible to connect the data associated with an HDInsight cluster and other data sources, including other (non-HDInsight) Hadoop clusters, from Excel using the Microsoft Power Query add-in for Excel.

trans-unit.source: For information on installing and using Power Query, see [Connect Excel to HDInsight with Power Query][hdinsight-power-query].
trans-unit.target: For information on installing and using Power Query, see [Connect Excel to HDInsight with Power Query][hdinsight-power-query].

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] While the steps in this article can be used with either a Linux or Windows-based HDInsight cluster, Windows is required for the client workstation.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] While the steps in this article can be used with either a Linux or Windows-based HDInsight cluster, Windows is required for the client workstation.

trans-unit.source: **Prerequisites**:
trans-unit.target: **Prerequisites**:

trans-unit.source: Before you begin this article, you must have the following:
trans-unit.target: Before you begin this article, you must have the following:

trans-unit.source: **An HDInsight cluster**.
trans-unit.target: **An HDInsight cluster**.

trans-unit.source: To configure one, see [Get started with Azure HDInsight][hdinsight-get-started].
trans-unit.target: To configure one, see [Get started with Azure HDInsight][hdinsight-get-started].

trans-unit.source: **A workstation** with Office 2013 Professional Plus, Office 365 Pro Plus, Excel 2013 Standalone, or Office 2010 Professional Plus.
trans-unit.target: **A workstation** with Office 2013 Professional Plus, Office 365 Pro Plus, Excel 2013 Standalone, or Office 2010 Professional Plus.

trans-unit.source: Install the Microsoft Hive ODBC Driver
trans-unit.target: Install the Microsoft Hive ODBC Driver

trans-unit.source: Download and install Microsoft Hive ODBC Driver from the [Download Center][hive-odbc-driver-download].
trans-unit.target: Download and install Microsoft Hive ODBC Driver from the [Download Center][hive-odbc-driver-download].

trans-unit.source: This driver can be installed on 32-bit or 64-bit versions of Windows 7, Windows 8, Windows Server 2008 R2 and Windows Server 2012 and will allow connection to Azure HDInsight (version 1.6 and later) and Azure HDInsight Emulator (v.1.0.0.0 and later).
trans-unit.target: This driver can be installed on 32-bit or 64-bit versions of Windows 7, Windows 8, Windows Server 2008 R2 and Windows Server 2012 and will allow connection to Azure HDInsight (version 1.6 and later) and Azure HDInsight Emulator (v.1.0.0.0 and later).

trans-unit.source: You should install the version that matches the version of the application where you will be using the ODBC driver.
trans-unit.target: You should install the version that matches the version of the application where you will be using the ODBC driver.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, the driver will be used from Office Excel.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, the driver will be used from Office Excel.

trans-unit.source: Create a Hive ODBC Data Source
trans-unit.target: Create a Hive ODBC Data Source

trans-unit.source: The following steps show you how to create a Hive ODBC Data Source.
trans-unit.target: The following steps show you how to create a Hive ODBC Data Source.

trans-unit.source: From Windows 8, press the Windows key to open the Start screen, and then type **data sources**.
trans-unit.target: From Windows 8, press the Windows key to open the Start screen, and then type **data sources**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Set up ODBC Data sources (32-bit)** or **Set up ODBC Data Sources (64-bit)** depending on your Office version.
trans-unit.target: Click **Set up ODBC Data sources (32-bit)** or **Set up ODBC Data Sources (64-bit)** depending on your Office version.

trans-unit.source: If you are using Windows 7, choose **ODBC Data Sources (32 bit)** or **ODBC Data Sources (64 bit)** from **Administrative Tools**.
trans-unit.target: If you are using Windows 7, choose **ODBC Data Sources (32 bit)** or **ODBC Data Sources (64 bit)** from **Administrative Tools**.

trans-unit.source: This will launch the **ODBC Data Source Administrator** dialog.
trans-unit.target: This will launch the **ODBC Data Source Administrator** dialog.

trans-unit.source: OBDC data source administrator
trans-unit.target: OBDC data source administrator

trans-unit.source: From User DNS, click **Add** to open the **Create New Data Source** wizard.
trans-unit.target: From User DNS, click **Add** to open the **Create New Data Source** wizard.

trans-unit.source: Select **Microsoft Hive ODBC Driver**, and then click **Finish**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Microsoft Hive ODBC Driver**, and then click **Finish**.

trans-unit.source: This will launch the **Microsoft Hive ODBC Driver DNS Setup** dialog.
trans-unit.target: This will launch the **Microsoft Hive ODBC Driver DNS Setup** dialog.

trans-unit.source: Type or select the following values:
trans-unit.target: Type or select the following values:

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Data Source Name
trans-unit.target: Data Source Name

trans-unit.source: Give a name to your data source
trans-unit.target: Give a name to your data source

trans-unit.source: Host
trans-unit.target: Host

trans-unit.source: Enter
trans-unit.target: Enter

trans-unit.source: .azurehdinsight.net.
trans-unit.target: .azurehdinsight.net.

trans-unit.source: For example, myHDICluster.azurehdinsight.net
trans-unit.target: For example, myHDICluster.azurehdinsight.net

trans-unit.source: Port
trans-unit.target: Port

trans-unit.source: Use 443.
trans-unit.target: Use 443.

trans-unit.source: (This port has been changed from 563 to 443.)
trans-unit.target: (This port has been changed from 563 to 443.)

trans-unit.source: Database
trans-unit.target: Database

trans-unit.source: Use Default.
trans-unit.target: Use Default.

trans-unit.source: Hive Server Type
trans-unit.target: Hive Server Type

trans-unit.source: Select Hive Server 2
trans-unit.target: Select Hive Server 2

trans-unit.source: Mechanism
trans-unit.target: Mechanism

trans-unit.source: Select Azure HDInsight Service
trans-unit.target: Select Azure HDInsight Service

trans-unit.source: HTTP Path
trans-unit.target: HTTP Path

trans-unit.source: Leave it blank.
trans-unit.target: Leave it blank.

trans-unit.source: User Name
trans-unit.target: User Name

trans-unit.source: Enter HDInsight cluster user username.
trans-unit.target: Enter HDInsight cluster user username.

trans-unit.source: This is the username created during the cluster provision process.
trans-unit.target: This is the username created during the cluster provision process.

trans-unit.source: If you used the quick create option, the default username is admin.
trans-unit.target: If you used the quick create option, the default username is admin.

trans-unit.source: Password
trans-unit.target: Password

trans-unit.source: Enter HDInsight cluster user password.
trans-unit.target: Enter HDInsight cluster user password.

trans-unit.source: There are some important parameters to be aware of when you click **Advanced Options**:
trans-unit.target: There are some important parameters to be aware of when you click **Advanced Options**:

trans-unit.source: Parameter
trans-unit.target: Parameter

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Use Native Query
trans-unit.target: Use Native Query

trans-unit.source: When it is selected, the ODBC driver will NOT try to convert TSQL into HiveQL.
trans-unit.target: When it is selected, the ODBC driver will NOT try to convert TSQL into HiveQL.

trans-unit.source: You shall use it only if you are 100% sure you are submitting pure HiveQL statements.
trans-unit.target: You shall use it only if you are 100% sure you are submitting pure HiveQL statements.

trans-unit.source: When connecting to SQL Server or Azure SQL Database, you should leave it unchecked.
trans-unit.target: When connecting to SQL Server or Azure SQL Database, you should leave it unchecked.

trans-unit.source: Rows fetched per block
trans-unit.target: Rows fetched per block

trans-unit.source: When fetching a large amount of records, tuning this parameter may be required to ensure optimal performances.
trans-unit.target: When fetching a large amount of records, tuning this parameter may be required to ensure optimal performances.

trans-unit.source: Default string column length, Binary column length, Decimal column scale
trans-unit.target: Default string column length, Binary column length, Decimal column scale

trans-unit.source: The data type lengths and precisions may affect how data is returned.
trans-unit.target: The data type lengths and precisions may affect how data is returned.

trans-unit.source: They will cause incorrect information to be returned due to loss of precision and/or truncation.
trans-unit.target: They will cause incorrect information to be returned due to loss of precision and/or truncation.

trans-unit.source: Click **Test** to test the data source.
trans-unit.target: Click **Test** to test the data source.

trans-unit.source: When the data source is configured correctly, it shows *TESTS COMPLETED SUCCESSFULLY!*.
trans-unit.target: When the data source is configured correctly, it shows *TESTS COMPLETED SUCCESSFULLY!*.

trans-unit.source: Click **OK** to close the Test dialog.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK** to close the Test dialog.

trans-unit.source: The new data source should now be listed on the **ODBC Data Source Administrator**.
trans-unit.target: The new data source should now be listed on the **ODBC Data Source Administrator**.

trans-unit.source: Click **OK** to exit the wizard.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK** to exit the wizard.

trans-unit.source: Import data into Excel from an HDInsight cluster
trans-unit.target: Import data into Excel from an HDInsight cluster

trans-unit.source: The steps below describe the way to import data from a hive table into an Excel workbook using the ODBC data source that you created in the steps above.
trans-unit.target: The steps below describe the way to import data from a hive table into an Excel workbook using the ODBC data source that you created in the steps above.

trans-unit.source: Open a new or existing workbook in Excel.
trans-unit.target: Open a new or existing workbook in Excel.

trans-unit.source: From the **Data** tab, click **From Other Data Sources**, and then click **From Data Connection Wizard** to launch the **Data Connection Wizard**.
trans-unit.target: From the **Data** tab, click **From Other Data Sources**, and then click **From Data Connection Wizard** to launch the **Data Connection Wizard**.

trans-unit.source: Open data connection wizard
trans-unit.target: Open data connection wizard

trans-unit.source: Select **ODBC DSN** as the data source, and then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Select **ODBC DSN** as the data source, and then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: From ODBC data sources, select the data source name that you created in the previous step, and then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: From ODBC data sources, select the data source name that you created in the previous step, and then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Re-enter the password for the cluster in the wizard, and then click **Test** to verify the configuration once again, if required.
trans-unit.target: Re-enter the password for the cluster in the wizard, and then click **Test** to verify the configuration once again, if required.

trans-unit.source: Click **OK** to close the test dialog.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK** to close the test dialog.

trans-unit.source: Click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: Wait for the **Select Database and Table** dialog to open.
trans-unit.target: Wait for the **Select Database and Table** dialog to open.

trans-unit.source: This can take a few seconds.
trans-unit.target: This can take a few seconds.

trans-unit.source: Select the table that you want to import, and then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Select the table that you want to import, and then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: The *hivesampletable* is a sample hive table that comes with HDInsight clusters.
trans-unit.target: The *hivesampletable* is a sample hive table that comes with HDInsight clusters.

trans-unit.source: You can choose it if you haven't created one.
trans-unit.target: You can choose it if you haven't created one.

trans-unit.source: For more information on run Hive queries and create Hive tables, see [Use Hive with HDInsight][hdinsight-use-hive].
trans-unit.target: For more information on run Hive queries and create Hive tables, see [Use Hive with HDInsight][hdinsight-use-hive].

trans-unit.source: Click **Finish**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Finish**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Import Data** dialog, you can change or specify the query.
trans-unit.target: In the **Import Data** dialog, you can change or specify the query.

trans-unit.source: To do so, click **Properties**.
trans-unit.target: To do so, click **Properties**.

trans-unit.source: This can take a few seconds.
trans-unit.target: This can take a few seconds.

trans-unit.source: Click on the **Definition** tab, and then append **LIMIT 200** to the Hive select statement in the **Command text** textbox.
trans-unit.target: Click on the **Definition** tab, and then append **LIMIT 200** to the Hive select statement in the **Command text** textbox.

trans-unit.source: The modification will limit the returned record set to 200.
trans-unit.target: The modification will limit the returned record set to 200.

trans-unit.source: Connection Properties
trans-unit.target: Connection Properties

trans-unit.source: Click **OK** to close the Connection Properties dialog.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK** to close the Connection Properties dialog.

trans-unit.source: Click **OK** to close the **Import Data** dialog.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK** to close the **Import Data** dialog.

trans-unit.source: Re-enter the password, and then click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Re-enter the password, and then click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: It takes a few seconds before data gets imported to Excel.
trans-unit.target: It takes a few seconds before data gets imported to Excel.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: In this article you learned how to use the Microsoft Hive ODBC driver to retrieve data from the HDInsight Service into Excel.
trans-unit.target: In this article you learned how to use the Microsoft Hive ODBC driver to retrieve data from the HDInsight Service into Excel.

trans-unit.source: Similarly, you can retrieve data from the HDInsight Service into SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: Similarly, you can retrieve data from the HDInsight Service into SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: It is also possible to upload data into an HDInsight Service.
trans-unit.target: It is also possible to upload data into an HDInsight Service.

trans-unit.source: To learn more, see:
trans-unit.target: To learn more, see:

trans-unit.source: Analyze flight delay data using HDInsight
trans-unit.target: Analyze flight delay data using HDInsight

trans-unit.source: Upload Data to HDInsight
trans-unit.target: Upload Data to HDInsight

trans-unit.source: Use Sqoop with HDInsight
trans-unit.target: Use Sqoop with HDInsight

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
